title: Cateran Hole Walk Route

images.title: J C Ousby / Cateran's Hole
images.caption: Cateran's Hole. This tunnel cave is in the middle of an isolated moor. The cave extends for a very long distance under the moor. Locals say it runs from Hepburn to Chillingham Castle

images.title: Les Hull / Bridleway over Quarryhouse Moor
images.caption: Bridleway over Quarryhouse Moor

images.title: Road and farmland, Botany by Richard Webb, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Road and farmland, Botany

description: This walk visits Cateran Hole, a cave located in a crater on Cateran Hill in Northumberland. At the intriguing site you can walk down some steps into the narrow passage of the cave and then crawl into a small chamber if you feel brave enough. The walk starts from the car park at Hepburn Woods which lies about 3 miles to the west of the hole. From here you can follow paths east to Hepburn Crags and then on to the old Quarry on Quarryhouse Moor. Around here you will find a footpath heading south and then east across the moor to Cateran Hole. It's a rather unique location with the unusual hole in a remote location on the moors. There are grassy verges near to the path down to the cave where you could park a bit closer if you prefer. On the walk you will pass Ros Castle where there's a splendid viewpoint and an Iron Age Hillfort.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The nearby Chillingham Castle has some nice tea rooms where you could enjoy some refreshments after your walk. The 13th century castle also has some lovely grounds and gardens to explore.
